required: You have not answered the question. You need to select an answer before continuing.
notAnswered: You have not answered the question.
errorSaving: Sorry, we’re having technical problems saving your application. Please try again in a few minutes.
CookieUse: We use some essential cookies to make this service work.
CookieAnalytics: We’d also like to use analytics cookies so we can understand how you use the service and make improvements.
CookieAccepted: You’ve accepted additional cookies. You can change your cookie settings at any time.
CookieRejected: You’ve rejected additional cookies. You can change your cookie settings at any time.
addressPageHeader: What is your contact or home address?
addressPageText: We'll send any correspondence to this address.
respondentPageText: You should be able to find the address on your payslips, contract or other official documents.
respondentInsetText: This should be the same respondent address given to Acas.
workAddressPageHeader: What’s the postcode where you worked or work?
workAddressPageText1: This will usually decide which Employment Tribunal office deals with your claim.  If you worked at home, enter the home postcode at which you work or worked.
workAddressPageText2: If you’re claiming against someone you did not work for, enter the postcode of where they are based.
respondentManualAddress: The respondent address is outside the UK
workManualAddress: My work address is outside the UK

addressEnterPostcode.invalid: Enter a valid postcode. For example, SW1 1AA
addressEnterPostcode.required: Enter a postcode. For example, SW1 1AA

workEnterPostcode.invalid: Enter a valid postcode. For example, SW1 1AA
workEnterPostcode.required: Enter a postcode. For example, SW1 1AA

respondentEnterPostcode.invalid: Enter a valid postcode. For example, SW1 1AA
respondentEnterPostcode.required: Enter a postcode. For example, SW1 1AA

cannotFindAddress: I cannot find my address in the list
updateDraftErrorMessage: There is an error while updating your case. Please click this error message to go back to steps to making your claim and re-enter the details.
